alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Astronomers in some cases are beginning to remodel their ideas on meteors, but as a class they hug caution and are as fearful of having their dogmas upset as a witch-doctor his magic."

- Comyns Beaumont, The Mysterious Comet, 1932
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Astronomers and Meteors
